newsitem.title: SWEDEN: S&P assigns ratings to Norway's Statkraft SF.
newsitem.headline: S&P assigns ratings to Norway's Statkraft SF.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said it assigned its AA+ long-term and A-1+ short-term issuer credit ratings to Statkraft SF of Norway. It said the long-term rating outlook is stable.
S&P said the ratings reflect Statkraft's state enterprise status and strong relationship with the Kingdom of Norway, which has AAA/A-1+ foreign currency debt ratings with a stable outlook.
Electricity generator Statkraft is wholly owned by the Kingdom of Norway, and there is no intention to privatise it, the ratings agency said.
Because of Statkraft's strategic importance to Norway's electricity production, S&P said it believed the government has strong incentives to provide timely financial assistance if and when needed.
